company_profile.industry: Business Intelligence & Analytics / Retail Decision Intelligence SaaS

leadership.founders: Peter Denby, Adam Barrowcliff (Chief Data Officer), Damon Bryan (Chief Technology Officer), Thomas Hill (Chief Customer Officer)

company_profile.funding_status: Private - Seed funding from Snowflake Ventures (2023), Finance Yorkshire and River Capital (2025)
company_profile.description: HyperFinity is a decision intelligence platform for retailers and consumer brands that combines data science, machine learning, and AI to optimize commercial decisions. The cloud-based, no-code SaaS platform enables retailers to make data-driven decisions across product assortment, pricing and promotions, marketing and loyalty, retail media, and supply chain without requiring technical expertise. Built on Snowflake's data platform, HyperFinity serves major UK retailers including Asda, Costa, Card Factory, Hotel Chocolat, and Toolstation.

competitors.primary_differentiation: Universal AI platform for technical and business users vs. retail-specific decision intelligence; broader industry coverage but less retail-focused features
Commercial AI platform with retail applications vs. pure retail decision intelligence; now part of UiPath automation ecosystem

competitors.customer_segment: Enterprise clients across sectors including retail, B2B
competitors.primary_differentiation: Bespoke AI solutions and consultancy vs. productized SaaS platform; broader industry focus beyond retail
Full supply chain and commerce platform vs. decision intelligence focus; targets larger enterprises with complex requirements
Pricing and promotion optimization specialist vs. broader decision intelligence across multiple retail functions

competitors.customer_segment: Large grocery retailers, CPG brands, B2B
competitors.primary_differentiation: Customer data science and retail media focus vs. end-to-end decision intelligence platform; consultancy-heavy model
Integrated POS and retail management system with AI pricing vs. pure analytics and decision intelligence platform
Computer vision and image recognition for retail vs. customer and product decision intelligence
In-store analytics and shopper behavior tracking vs. customer-product decision intelligence and optimization
Self-service BI search analytics platform vs. retail-specific decision intelligence with embedded AI recommendations

research_quality_summary.geographic_relevance: High UK focus - competitors include UK-founded (Peak, Faculty, dunnhumby), UK-active (Dataiku, Blue Yonder), and global platforms with UK presence
research_quality_summary.customer_journey_coverage: Complete - Problem Awareness through Decision/Transaction stages with emphasis on Consideration and Evaluation phases
research_quality_summary.confidence_justification: Company profile verified from official website, LinkedIn, CB Insights, and multiple credible news sources. Competitors identified through CB Insights alternatives, industry analysis, and market research. Funding and leadership confirmed through UK Tech News and Retail Tech Innovation Hub. Client portfolio validated through company website and case studies.
research_quality_summary.ranking_methodology: Ranked by: (1) Win/loss battle frequency in UK retail decision intelligence market, (2) Geographic overlap with UK market, (3) Customer segment alignment (mid-market to enterprise retailers), (4) Product overlap across pricing, assortment, loyalty functions, (5) Direct vs aspirational competition (80/20 split). Top competitors (Dataiku, Peak, Faculty) compete directly for same buyers; mid-tier (Blue Yonder, Revionics, dunnhumby) overlap specific functions; lower-ranked serve adjacent use cases or different segments.

metadata.research_methodology: AEO (Answer Engine Optimization) competitive benchmarking per AEO_Research_V2.md specifications
data_sources: CB Insights company and competitor profiles
UK Tech News and Retail Tech Innovation Hub articles
Snowflake Ventures and Finance Yorkshire investment announcements
Industry platform comparisons and retail analytics market research
